_source.content: Disinformation Panels, Control over Social Media Content and Now DOJ Environmental Justice, it is all One Long ContinuumMay 5, 2022 | Sundance Barack Obama and Eric Holder did not create a weaponized DOJ and FBI; instead, what they did was take the preexisting system and retool it, so the weapons only targeted one side of the political continuum.  This point is where many people get confused.Prior to 9/11/01 the greatest threat to government was considered to be from outside the U.S, vis-a-vis terrorism.  After 9/11/01 the greatest threat was redefined, Americans were now considered the threat, the enemy tracking radar was turned around to look inside America.In the era shortly after 9/11, the DC national security apparatus was constructed to preserve continuity of government and simultaneously view all Americans as potential threats.  The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) were created specifically for this purpose.DHS and ODNI were created because Americans were now the threat to government. Stop. Pause. Think.  You are taking off your shoes at the airports because YOU are the threat.  You pass through body scanners because YOU are the threat.  Stop. Pause. Think.  How does that define your relationship with government?Fast forward five years ‚Äì What Barack Obama and Eric Holder did with that new surveillance and security construct was refine the internal targeting mechanisms so that only their political (ideological) opposition became the target of the new national security system.This distinction is very important to understand as you dig deeper into this research outline.Washington DC created the modern national security apparatus immediately and hurriedly after 9/11/01.  DHS came along in 2002 and within the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004 the ODNI was formed. When Barack Obama and Eric Holder arrived a few years later, those newly formed institutions were viewed as opportunities to create a very specific national security apparatus that would focus almost exclusively against their political opposition. [rest @ link]https://theconservativetreehouse.com/blog/2022/05/05/disinformation-panels-control-over-social-media-content-and-now-doj-environmental-justice-it-is-all-one-long-continuum/
_source.contentraw:
Disinformation Panels, Control over Social Media Content and Now DOJ Environmental Justice, it is all One Long Continuum
May 5, 2022 | Sundance

Barack Obama and Eric Holder did not create a weaponized DOJ and FBI; instead, what they did was take the preexisting system and retool it, so the weapons only targeted one side of the political continuum. This point is where many people get confused.

Prior to 9/11/01 the greatest threat to government was considered to be from outside the U.S, vis-a-vis terrorism. After 9/11/01 the greatest threat was redefined, Americans were now considered the threat, the enemy tracking radar was turned around to look inside America.

In the era shortly after 9/11, the DC national security apparatus was constructed to preserve continuity of government and simultaneously view all Americans as potential threats. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) were created specifically for this purpose.

DHS and ODNI were created because Americans were now the threat to government. Stop. Pause. Think. You are taking off your shoes at the airports because YOU are the threat. You pass through body scanners because YOU are the threat. Stop. Pause. Think. How does that define your relationship with government?

Fast forward five years ‚Äì What Barack Obama and Eric Holder did with that new surveillance and security construct was refine the internal targeting mechanisms so that only their political (ideological) opposition became the target of the new national security system.

This distinction is very important to understand as you dig deeper into this research outline.

Washington DC created the modern national security apparatus immediately and hurriedly after 9/11/01. DHS came along in 2002 and within the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004 the ODNI was formed.

When Barack Obama and Eric Holder arrived a few years later, those newly formed institutions were viewed as opportunities to create a very specific national security apparatus that would focus almost exclusively against their political opposition. [rest @ link]
https://theconservativetreehouse.com/blog/2022/05/05/disinformation-panels-control-over-social-media-content-and-now-doj-environmental-justice-it-is-all-one-long-continuum/

group.description:
Brothers and Sisters in Christ, I‚Äôm @shooglenifty and my fellow administrator is @libertyordeath777. 

God is good and His mercy endures forever!
***
By posting you are agreeing to our posting standards. We will remove a post that doesn't follow the guidelines below.
***
My hopes for the group is to foster phileo between the Christian diaspora that has chosen to join this group. We want to be a place where unbelievers come for answers and believers come to be bolstered in their faith. By the grace of God through the blood of Jesus we will bring His love to multitudes. My reasoning? I believe this: "Never doubt God‚Äôs mighty power to work in you and accomplish all this. He will achieve infinitely more than your greatest request, your most unbelievable dream, and exceed your wildest imagination! He will outdo them all, for his miraculous power constantly energizes you.‚ÄùEphesians 3:20 TPT
***
PLEASE READ BEFORE POSTING:
Posts that are encouraged (think ENGAGEMENT! and WHAT IS GOD TELLING YOU!):
1. Testimonies, praise reports, prayer requests, encouragements, prophecies, words from God, exhortations, etc.
2. Questions of those looking to our community for answers that only God can give.
3. Sermons, articles, videos, pictures and verses as long as they have a good description outlining who, what, where, why and how. If you don't respect the link you are posting or the other Christians in the group enough to take some time with your post, please don't post it. 
***
It seems most just post and run (seagull posting) and this is not God's heart nor mine. This group has ONE timeline. It also has many members. Is it respectful on your part to post several one line posts in a row pushing someone else's well thought post or plea out of sight of the group? With that in mind the following types of posts will be removed at the sole discretion of the moderators:
1. Off topic posts: politics, begging for followers or money, promoting personal agendas, etc.
2. Intentionally divisive, disrespectful or racist posts
3. Low effort (Just posting a video/link is not sufficient within the group, you must also write YOUR OWN description of the link/video; the included video/link description is not acceptable) or multiple posts in a row (limit of 2 posts per 3 hours)
4. Posts that don't meet the criteria mentioned above
5. Any reposts from other groups that are unrelated to Christianity; reposts of posts already in the group timeline (if you agree with a post just say it in the original post); and any reposts of your disagreements within a post brought to the group timeline.
6. Anyone who spams the same post to multiple groups (yes, I check timelines)
7. All members who block the administrators and moderators will be removed.
***
Remember that we are the body of Christ. Please keep your posts in line with Philippians 4:8 (ESV): Finally brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence, if there is anything worthy of praise, think (post!) about these things.
***
‚ÄúThe Lord bless you and keep you; the Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace. ‚ÄúSo shall they put my name upon the people of Israel, and I will bless them.‚Äù‚ÄùNumbers 6:24-27 ESV

Two Republican-led states have reportedly filed a lawsuit against President Joe Biden and other top administration officials, alleging they ‚Äúpressured and colluded‚Äù with Big Tech companies to squash The Post‚Äôs Hunter Biden laptop story and censor information related to COVID-19‚Äôs lab origins.

The lawsuit, filed Thursday by Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry, accuses top government officials of conspiring to suppress information with social media giants Meta, Twitter and YouTube ‚Äúunder the guise of combating misinformation,‚Äù Fox News reported.

White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki, Dr. Anthony Fauci, and Nina Jankowicz ‚Äî the head of the Department of Homeland Security‚Äôs (DHS) new and controversial ‚ÄúDisinformation Governance Board‚Äù were among the other top officials and federal agencies named as defendants in the suit, which was filed in the US District Court for the Western District of Louisiana.

The 86-page suit accuses the federal government of violating free speech rights by threatening big tech companies into silencing conservative viewpoints.

platforms under the Orwellian guise of halting so-called ‚Äòdisinformation,‚Äô ‚Äòmisinformation,‚Äô and ‚Äòmalinformation‚Äô.‚ÄùIn an exclusive statement to Fox News Digital, Missouri Attorney _source.contentraw:
States sue Biden over Big Tech ‚Äòcollusion.‚Äô

Missouri and Louisiana Attorneys General have accused the US president of ‚Äòcolluding‚Äô with Big Tech to censor information.

Attorneys General from two Republican-led US states, Missouri and Louisiana, have filed a lawsuit against the Biden administration, Fox News reported on Thursday. The states are accusing high-ranking officials, including President Joe Biden, of having ‚Äúpressured and colluded‚Äù with social media companies to censor and suppress information on a number of big stories over the past two years.

Among the officials named as defendants are White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki and the President‚Äôs Chief Medical Advisor Dr. Anthony Fauci. They, and others, are accused of exerting undue pressure on, or working together, with a number of Big Tech companies such as Meta, Twitter and YouTube to suppress information regarding the Hunter Biden laptop controversy, the origins of Covid-19, and security concerns associated with mail-in voting during the pandemic.

Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry claim the Biden Administration has been doing so ‚Äúunder the guise of combating misinformation.‚Äù

The lawsuit, filed on Thursday in the U.S. District Court for the Western District of Louisiana, describes the administration‚Äôs supposed efforts to hush up certain information as ‚Äúone of its greatest assaults by federal government officials in the Nation's history‚Äù on Americans‚Äô constitutional right to free speech.

The filing goes on to claim that ‚ÄúHaving threatened and cajoled social-media platforms for years to censor viewpoints and speakers disfavored by the Left, senior government officials in the Executive Branch have moved into a phase of open collusion with social-media companies to suppress disfavored speakers, viewpoints, and content on social-media platforms under the Orwellian guise of halting so-called ‚Äòdisinformation,‚Äô ‚Äòmisinformation,‚Äô and ‚Äòmalinformation‚Äô.‚Äù

In an exclusive statement to Fox News Digital, Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt explained the decision to file the lawsuit by saying that he would ‚Äúnot stand idly by while the Biden Administration attempts to trample on the First Amendment rights of Missourians and Americans.‚Äù

His colleague from the state of Louisiana, Jeff Landry, went so far as to characterize Big Tech as an ‚Äúextension of Biden‚Äôs Big Government,‚Äù which is busy ‚Äúsuppressing truth and demonizing those who think differently.‚Äù Landry compared Joe Biden to Joseph Stalin over the president‚Äôs policies that allegedly aim to ‚Äúcensor free speech and propagandize the masses.‚Äù The Attorney General said the lawsuit was seeking to ‚Äúensure the rule of law and prevent the government from unconstitutional banning, chilling, and stifling of speech.‚Äù

_source.content: Lawmakers criticize Facebook for censoring local Wisconsin conservative news outlet-Reclaim the NetRepublican politicians have criticized Facebook for removing the page of a highly-rated Wisconsin-based conservative outlet, the Wisconsin Right Now.  According to the outlet, Facebook did not provide a reason for the removal of the page. Efforts to appeal the decision have been unsuccessful.Republican politicians have criticized Facebook for its decision and demanded the page be reinstated.Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson said: ‚ÄúJust like they‚Äôve repeatedly done to me, liberal Big Tech social media giants are censoring conservatives in Wisconsin because they are countering the narrative of the radical left that is destroying America.‚ÄúThis is further escalation in their insidious war on free speech and represents a true danger to our democracy. Democrats and their allies in Big Tech will continue to censor and suppress conservatives unless we fight back and win.‚ÄùThe candidate for the state attorney general seat Eric Toney promised to ‚Äúwork with state and federal attorneys general to use antitrust laws to hold big tech accountable‚Äù if he is elected. He said the censorship of the page is an ‚Äúattack on free speech.‚Äù‚ÄúIt‚Äôs absurd that Facebook is censoring Wisconsin‚Äôs top-ranked conservative news site in the middle of a critical midterm election year,‚Äù said Kevin Nicholson, who hopes to be the next governor of Wisconsin.‚ÄúFacebook continues to show its bias and corruption as they choose to censor voters from learning about reality ‚Äì just as they did in the 2020 election. Facebook should absolutely reverse their decision and uncensor Wisconsin Right Now‚Äôs page immediately.‚ÄùFormer Lieutenant Governor for Wisconsin Rebecca Kleefisch said:  ‚ÄúUnaccountable Big tech companies continue to silence conservative voices. Wisconsin Right Now does important work educating conservative voters and covering the things they care about. Those same conservatives deserve to have their voices heard, and Facebook should immediately reverse course.‚Äù
_source.contentraw:
Lawmakers criticize Facebook for censoring local Wisconsin conservative news outlet-Reclaim the Net

Republican politicians have criticized Facebook for removing the page of a highly-rated Wisconsin-based conservative outlet, the Wisconsin Right Now. According to the outlet, Facebook did not provide a reason for the removal of the page. Efforts to appeal the decision have been unsuccessful.
Republican politicians have criticized Facebook for its decision and demanded the page be reinstated.
Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson said: ‚ÄúJust like they‚Äôve repeatedly done to me, liberal Big Tech social media giants are censoring conservatives in Wisconsin because they are countering the narrative of the radical left that is destroying America.
‚ÄúThis is further escalation in their insidious war on free speech and represents a true danger to our democracy. Democrats and their allies in Big Tech will continue to censor and suppress conservatives unless we fight back and win.‚Äù
The candidate for the state attorney general seat Eric Toney promised to ‚Äúwork with state and federal attorneys general to use antitrust laws to hold big tech accountable‚Äù if he is elected. He said the censorship of the page is an ‚Äúattack on free speech.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs absurd that Facebook is censoring Wisconsin‚Äôs top-ranked conservative news site in the middle of a critical midterm election year,‚Äù said Kevin Nicholson, who hopes to be the next governor of Wisconsin.
‚ÄúFacebook continues to show its bias and corruption as they choose to censor voters from learning about reality ‚Äì just as they did in the 2020 election. Facebook should absolutely reverse their decision and uncensor Wisconsin Right Now‚Äôs page immediately.‚Äù
Former Lieutenant Governor for Wisconsin Rebecca Kleefisch said: ‚ÄúUnaccountable Big tech companies continue to silence conservative voices. Wisconsin Right Now does important work educating conservative voters and covering the things they care about. Those same conservatives deserve to have their voices heard, and Facebook should immediately reverse course.‚Äù

Rising Republican Party Influencers Got Their Start At Talent Agency Run By Israeli Pornographer. By Eric Striker.

They‚Äôre prominent guests on Fox, they lead ‚Äúgrassroots‚Äù rallies, they write columns at The Blaze, they are keynote speakers at CPAC, a few were even used to blackmail perceived enemies of Israeli interests ‚Äî and they all got their start as actors and models at the same Israeli-owned talent agency.

These up and coming conservative superstars appear to have had or currently still have active profiles up at shadowy Israeli-born pornographer Ami Shafrir‚Äôs Explore Talent ‚Ä¶

So far, National Justice has identified the following household names in the world of Republican Party politics as being actors or models featured for hire on the site in the last ten years:

1) Candace Owens ‚Äî who began producing professional conservative content months after launching her Explore Talent profile in 2017.

2) Congresswoman Lauren Boebert ‚Äî participated in the site‚Äôs gallery contest in 2011, two years before opening up the ‚ÄúShooters Grill‚Äù restaurant that brought her national fame and helped catapult her political career.

3) Tomi Lahren ‚Äî a familiar face throughout conservative media. She has previously worked at The Blaze and served on Donald Trump‚Äôs PAC alongside Rudy Giuliani. She currently works as a contributor for Fox News.

4) Mellissa Carone ‚Äî Rudy Giuliani‚Äôs star witness in his election fraud lawsuit last December. She is currently running for office in Michigan.

5) Scott Presler ‚Äî a homosexual conservative influencer, often spotted leading rallies in the run up to Trump‚Äôs election. Presler spoke at CPAC 2020.

7) Anna Khait and Tarah Price ‚Äî Two women hired by private intelligence operatives to seduce and blackmail National Security Adviser Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster after Jewish mega donors Sheldon Adelson and Robert Mercer complained to Trump that he wasn‚Äôt sufficiently pro-Israel. ‚Ä¶

All in all, the overnight transition of women from low-rent ‚Äúmodels‚Äù on Explore Talent to congresswomen, high-risk spies, and nationally renown political personalities leaves more questions than answers.

The most innocent explanation ‚Äî that GOP operatives are actively recruiting women who are broke and desperate for fame ‚Äî speaks volumes about the state of American conservatism.

_source.content: There's a dangerous new trend on MSNBC, led by insincere pseudo-intellectuals like Chris Hayes, to say that "democracy doesn't work" any time that Democrats receive an election result, vote in Congress, or Supreme Court decision that they don't like. This started with Hillary Clinton claiming that "Russia!" cost her the 2016 election when she was actually a crappy candidate: she vastly outspent Donald Trump but didn't bother visiting Wisconsin after the primaries. (I doubt that she'll ever run again after losing to Barack Obama and Trump, despite having huge monetary and institutional advantages in both races.) Regardless, you have to wonder what MSNBC's alternatives are to democracy. Forced mask mandates? Endless lockdowns? Teaching kindergarteners that doctors can't identify boys and girls (they're just guessing, right?) and that they can change their biological sex? Calling everyone a "racist" to shut down conversations?

Counting on Mark Zuckerberg to get out the vote while censoring Facebook?

Endless riots?

Fascism?

The same party that said that Trump was undermining democracy at every turn actually seeks to undermine democracy at every turn.

Excerpt:

Other members of the political media landscape, including MSNBC's Rachel Maddow, Nicolle Wallace, Joy Reid and Michigan AG Dana Nessel, all made repeated claims that future Republican victories in the midterms or 2024 would be the "end of democracy."

Taking the dire warning a step further, some also asserted the GOP would be the "death of democracy" because Democrats failed on passing [so-called] voting rights and ending the filibuster.

During the Black Lives Matter protests and riots of the summer of 2020, Dr. Michael Eric Dyson said on ABC News that the civil unrest was not just about the death of George Floyd but also about the "death" of American democracy.

In addition, Rosie O'Donnell, The Washington Post's Jonathan Capehart, and MSNBC's Zerlina Maxwell warned viewers about the "death" of democracy.

The GOP isn't the sole threat to democracy according to the liberal media. They also often cite the U.S. Constitution, an insufficient amount of censorship, and parents protesting at school board meetings as threats to democracy. However, if voters elect more Republicans in the midterm elections, viewers can expect a flurry of eulogies on American democracy.

Joe Biden Is Sued By State Attorney Generals For Colluding With Big Tech On Censorship

May 6, 2022

Filed by Louisiana and Missouri.

Joe Biden and multiple top officials in his administration have been sued by two Republican-led states for pressuring and collusion with Big Tech to suppress free speech. The suit cites the Hunter Biden laptop story, the lab-leak theory, the security of mail-in voting, and the effectiveness of cloth masks.

The lawsuit was filed by Louisiana's and Missouri's attorneys general Jeff Landry and Eric Schmitt. They accuse top government officials, including Biden, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki, Dr. Anthony Fauci, and the head of the DHS' newly formed Disinformation Governance Board Nina Jankowicz, of colluding with Big Tech to suppress free speech and pressuring platforms to censor conservative voices.

"Having threatened and cajoled social-media platforms for years to censor viewpoints and speakers disfavored by the Left, senior government officials in the Executive Branch have moved into a phase of open collusion with social media companies to suppress disfavored speakers, viewpoints, and content on social-media platforms under the Orwellian guise of halting so-called 'disinformation.' 'misinformation,' and 'malinformation,'" the filling claims.

"Labeling disfavored speech 'misinformation' or 'disinformation' does not strip it of First Amendment Protection... with the common understanding that some false statements are inevitable if there is to be an open and vigorous expression of views in public and private conversation... the First Amendment seeks to guarantee."

The suit cites the censorship of the Hunter Biden laptop story published by the New York Post in October 2020, a few weeks to the presidential election.

"Perhaps most notoriously, social media platforms aggressively censored an October 14, 2020 New York Post expose about the contents of the laptop of Hunter Biden, which had been abandoned in a Delaware repair shop and contained compromising photos and email communications about corrupt foreign business deals," the suit states.

Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube censored, removed, and limited the spread of the story. 17 months after the New York Post published the story, the Washington Post and the New York Times authenticated the contents of the laptop.

The lawsuit also notes that Big Tech platforms "aggressively" censored "speech that raised concerns about the security of voting by mail, a major election-security issue."

It also cites the censorship of content suggesting that COVID-19 leaked from a lab. Many studies have since supported the lab-leak theory. The attorneys general accuse Dr. Fauci of "orchestrating a campaign to falsely discredit the lab-leak theory."

https://reclaimthenet.org/biden-is-sued-by-state-ags-for-colluding-with-big-tech-on-censorship/
